group_1.textLeft: I'm going to go speak to them, then.@Could you wait here for a moment...?

group_1.textRight: Roger...
Um, am I gonna have to take your place after all...?

group_1.textLeft: That won't be necessary...@I'm just going to accept their feelings.
Council President,
Thank you for coming all this way today.
I'll cut to the chase.
Recently, you've been missing more and more@of our meetings.
What's the reason for this?
...Thanks to you, this school's been changing.
It's made life easier for people like us.
You're the one who made all of this possible, Prez...
Honestly,@we didn't want to have to bring this up either.

group_1.textRight: No, it's quite alright...
It is true that I've been absent from a lot of meetings.
I understand that you each have your own feelings@about the matter.

group_1.textLeft: We're still okay with it.
Even if you're not showing up,@you're still doing your job.
We know you're not slacking off.
The average student, on the other hand...
Those who aren't familiar with the student council
could find out about the president's absence@and make an issue out of it.
If that happens, even for a short while,@you could catch some unfair judgement.
It's just frustrating for us.
You're doing everything you can, Prez.
The fact that you're not getting the recognition@you deserve... It's frustrating.

group_1.textRight: You girls...
...Thank you...
I have a favor to ask of you today.
Would you hear me out...?

group_1.textLeft: ...Sure.

group_1.textRight: ...I'd like you to be patient a little while longer...
My personal life is very busy right now...
I'm afraid I can't disclose the details of the situation.
However, once it's resolved,@I will absolutely come back.
I'm going to work with everyone@to further reform our school.
...Given my position as student council president,
I know this is selfish of me to ask...
But even so...@Please...
I just need a little more time...
For the sake of my pride,@there is something I must do first.
